snippet: Strategies include front-loading national commercials early in a show and extending hit shows a minute or two into the following hour.
abstract: Television executives use programming sleight of hand to gain every possible edge in the ratings game, as each tenth of a point or two enhances their standing in the nightly ratings and the ability to pitch to advertisers; strategies including front-loading national commercials early in a show and extending hit shows a minute or two into the following hour.
lead_paragraph: Strategies include front-loading national commercials early in a show and extending hit shows a minute or two into the following hour.

headline.seo: Networks Resort to Trickery in an Attempt to Lift Ratings
headline.main: In Networks’ Race for Ratings, Chicanery Is on the Schedule
headline.print_headline: In Networks’ Race for Ratings, Chicanery Is on the Schedule
